text:
Are UK vacations per day periodic?
I can imagine a peak on certain days like e.g. a bunch of GPs were opening up on Saturday solely for vaccinations only.
And a ton being closed entirely on Sunday

But not that it seems the peak is followed by a trough and slowly builds back up.

Are they running out of vaccines, then not sure when they will get more and so don't pre-book patients?
And then patients need a few days notice to get in?

elements.text:

I can imagine a peak on certain days like e.g. a bunch of GPs were opening up on Saturday solely for vaccinations only.

text: yeah, they definitely have a weekly pattern.  I don't know if it there is a report delay or what, but there is a periodic effect

elements.text: yeah, they definitely have a weekly pattern.  I don't know if it there is a report delay or what, but there is a periodic effect

text: In México this is happening for two factors: One, the delivery was weekly (until Pfizer slowed down production and we didn’t get more deliveries), this caused that large urban centers applied their share very fast and then smaller, remote areas continued vaccinating as they received their doses. There is also some slower component because of the two doses.

elements.text: In México this is happening for two factors: One, the delivery was weekly (until Pfizer slowed down production and we didn’t get more deliveries), this caused that large urban centers applied their share very fast and then smaller, remote areas continued vaccinating as they received their doses. There is also some slower component because of the two doses.

text: I had heard that vaccination sites don't report numbers every day, so I had assumed there's an element of the administrators going "better get those numbers in" towards the end of the week
